pyhpeimc.plat.groups module¶

pyhpeimc.plat.groups.HEADERS = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json', 'Accept-encoding': 'application/json'}¶

This section deals with HPE IMC Custom View functions

pyhpeimc.plat.groups.add_devs_custom_views(custom_view_name, dev_list, auth, url)[source]¶
function takes a list of devIDs from devices discovered in the HPE IMC platform and and issues a RESTFUL call to
add the list of devices to a specific custom views from HPE IMC.
Parameters:
  • dev_list – list containing the devID of all devices to be contained in this custom view.
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
Returns:

str of creation results ( “view ” + name + “created successfully”
Return type:

str

 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.groups import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")
pyhpeimc.plat.groups.create_custom_views(auth, url, name=None, upperview=None)[source]¶

function takes no input and issues a RESTFUL call to get a list of custom views from HPE IMC. Optional Name input will return only the specified view.

Parameters:
  • name – string containg the name of the desired custom view
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
Returns:

str of creation results ( “view ” + name + “created successfully”
Return type:

str

 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.groups import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

#Create L1 custom view >>> create_custom_views(auth.creds, auth.url, name=’L1 View’) ‘View L1 View created successfully’

>>> view_1 =get_custom_views( auth.creds, auth.url, name = 'L1 View')

>>> assert type(view_1) is list

>>> assert view_1[0]['name'] == 'L1 View'

#Create Nested custome view >>> create_custom_views(auth.creds, auth.url, name=’L2 View’, upperview=’L1 View’) ‘View L2 View created successfully’

>>> view_2 = get_custom_views( auth.creds, auth.url, name = 'L2 View')

>>> assert type(view_2) is list

>>> assert view_2[0]['name'] == 'L2 View'
pyhpeimc.plat.groups.delete_custom_view(auth, url, name)[source]¶

function takes input of auth, url, and name and issues a RESTFUL call to delete a specific of custom views from HPE IMC. :param name: string containg the name of the desired custom view

Parameters:
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
Returns:

str of creation results ( “view ” + name + “created successfully”
Return type:

str

 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.groups import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> delete_custom_view(auth.creds, auth.url, name = "L1 View")
'View L1 View deleted successfully'

>>> view_1 =get_custom_views( auth.creds, auth.url, name = 'L1 View')

>>> assert view_1 == None

>>> delete_custom_view(auth.creds, auth.url, name = "L2 View")
'View L2 View deleted successfully'

>>> view_2 =get_custom_views( auth.creds, auth.url, name = 'L2 View')

>>> assert view_2 == None
pyhpeimc.plat.groups.get_custom_view_details(name, auth, url)[source]¶

function requires no input and returns a list of dictionaries of custom views from an HPE IMC. Optional name argument will return only the specified view. :param name: str containing the name of the desired custom view

Parameters:
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
  • name – (optional) str of name of specific custom view
Returns:

list of dictionaties containing attributes of the custom views
Return type:

list

 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.groups import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> view_details = get_custom_view_details('My Network View', auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> assert type(view_details) is list

>>> assert 'label' in view_details[0]
pyhpeimc.plat.groups.get_custom_views(auth: object, url: object, name: object = None, headers: object = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json', 'Accept-encoding': 'application/json'}) → object[source]¶

function requires no input and returns a list of dictionaries of custom views from an HPE IMC. Optional name argument will return only the specified view. :param name: str containing the name of the desired custom view

Parameters:
  • auth – requests auth object #usually auth.creds from auth pyhpeimc.auth.class
  • url – base url of IMC RS interface #usually auth.url from pyhpeimc.auth.authclass
  • name – (optional) str of name of specific custom view
Returns:

list of dictionaties containing attributes of the custom views
Return type:

list

 
>>> from pyhpeimc.auth import *

>>> from pyhpeimc.plat.groups import *

>>> auth = IMCAuth("http://", "10.101.0.203", "8080", "admin", "admin")

>>> all_views = get_custom_views(auth.creds, auth.url)

>>> assert type(all_views) is list

>>> assert 'name' in all_views[0]

>>> non_existant_view = get_custom_views(auth.creds, auth.url, name = '''Doesn't Exist''')

>>> assert non_existant_view == None
